content: mylky way fingerless mittens these simple vanilla short-­ cuff mittens are perfect for when you already have bulky or tight sleeves around your wrists and you want to keep your hands warm but without adding the additional bulk around your wrist that often comes with gloves or mittens designer amanda hall new zealand published 2019 ravelry skill level beginner-­ friendly construction knit in the round on small circumference circular needles no seaming up size one-­ size fits most adult hand yarn weight dk / 8-­ ply yardage 65 metres 71 yards yarn i used 4 seasons marvel soft 8 ply in the colour 80250673 cream needles 1 x 3 25mm us 3 23cm 9 circular needle 1 x 4mm us 6 23cm 9 circular needle notions measuring tape or ruler 1 x stitch marker to mark the beginning-­ of-­ round 2 x stitch markers different to your beginning-­ of-­ round marker for the thumb yarn needle for weaving in the ends a row counter can be helpful abbreviations co -­ cast on see tutorial here st s -­ stitch es pm -­ place stitch marker onto right-­ hand needle sm -­ slip marker round s -­ round s k -­ knit p -­ purl 1x1 ribbing -­ k1 p1 repeat stockinette -­ knit all stitches kll -­ knit left loop increase see tutorial here krl -­ knit right loop increase see tutorial here k tbl -­ knit through back loop see tutorial here kfb -­ knit front and back see tutorial here pattern instructions make 2 cast on on the smaller needles and a 66cm 26 yarn tail co 38 sts using the long-­ tail co method see link to a tutorial in the abbreviations above © amanda hall for personal use only please do not sell or reproduce ribbed cuff pm to mark the beginning of round join in the round work in 1x1 ribbing for 6 rnds hand change to larger needles work 5 rnds in stockinette k17 pm k4 pm k to end of round thumb increases round 1 k to marker sm kll k to marker krl sm k to end of round rnds 2 & 3 work in stockinette repeat rnds 1-­ 3 until you have 14 sts in between the thumb stitch markers 48 sts k to marker remove marker kll k tbl and bind off the following 13 sts remove marker krl and bind off 1 st immediately ie lift second st on right needle over the krl st you just made and slip it off the needle k to end of round 36 sts note your piece should now have 18 sts each side of the beginning-­of-­round marker and 14 bound off sts in a row in the middle making the thumb hole k to 1 st before the bound off sts kfb twice ie kfb into 1 st either side of the thumb hole k to end of round 38 sts work 5 rnds in stockinette change to smaller needles work
